title: How to Make Omelette Muffins

steps.headline: Take a cutting board.
steps.description: Cut green onions and tomatoes into small dices. Place them aside.

steps.headline: Take a bowl and whisk the eggs.
steps.description: Add baking powder, oil and milk to it. Add salt and pepper to taste. Whisk this mixture till all ingredients blend well.

steps.headline: Grease your muffin or cupcake tray with the cooking oil.
Put a few amount of vegetables in each cup.
Pour the egg mixture in each cup slowly.
steps.description: Make sure not to fill it completely. Leave a little space for the muffins to rise.

steps.headline: Put the muffin tray in pre-heated oven.
Take out the tray when the muffins have risen.
steps.description: Let them cool for a minute.

steps.headline: Top with tomato sauce and enjoy your omelette muffins.

Pre-heat your oven at 180°. Leave it for 5-10 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c0\/Make-Omelette-Muffins-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c0\/Make-Omelette-Muffins-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Take a cutting board. Cut green onions and tomatoes into small dices. Place them aside. Take a bowl and whisk the eggs. Add baking powder, oil and milk to it. Add salt and pepper to taste. Whisk this mixture till all ingredients blend well. Grease your muffin or cupcake tray with the cooking oil. Put a few amount of vegetables in each cup. Top it with shredded cheese. Pour the egg mixture in each cup slowly. Make sure not to fill it completely. Leave a little space for the muffins to rise. Put the muffin tray in pre-heated oven. Bake at 375° for 20-25 minutes. Take out the tray when the muffins have risen. Let them cool for a minute. Top with tomato sauce and enjoy your omelette muffins.
